main event: A military observation of a stationary star-like object glowing reddish-white and green was reported at Ellsworth AFB, South Dakota on 5 September 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as being pin point in size and glowing,It was determined to be located at 220 degrees azimuth near the star Arcturus,There were no other aircraft or astronomical explanations provided,The observation was made under clear sky conditions at nighttime,Two USAF personnel confirmed the sighting.
witness description: USAF personnel, Lt. Dwyer and 2nd Lt. Roggenbuck
